hypothesis_content.title: Negative News Catalyst Amplification in Neutral Regime
hypothesis_content.statement: During NEUTRAL regimes (confidence > 55%), negative macro news catalysts (e.g., weak job reports, inflation surprises) will trigger an amplified BTC price decline of 3-5% within 24 hours, followed by a 48-hour mean reversion bounce of 1.5-2.5% as overreaction corrects.
hypothesis_content.rationale: Neutral regimes lack strong directional conviction, making prices more susceptible to news-driven sentiment shocks. Negative macro news triggers fear-driven selling, but without a fundamental regime shift, the overreaction tends to correct as liquidity returns and opportunistic buyers step in.
entry_conditions: Negative macro news headline (sentiment score < -0.6) confirmed by at least 2 major news sources
BTC 1-hour price drop > 1.5% within 2 hours of news release
BTC funding rates turn negative (perpetual futures)

exit_conditions.take_profit: BTC price rebounds +2.0% from entry price OR 48 hours pass
exit_conditions.stop_loss: BTC price drops -4.0% from entry price

hypothesis_content.falsification_criteria: Negative news fails to produce >1.5% initial drop OR price continues declining >5% without mean reversion within 72 hours in >40% of occurrences.
